thread.title: What time does the First Test in the Ashes 2015 start tomorrow and what TV channel is it on?
thread.title_full: What time does the First Test in the Ashes 2015 start tomorrow and what TV channel is it on? - Telegraph

author: Telegraph Sport
title: What time does the First Test in the Ashes 2015 start tomorrow and what TV channel is it on?
text: When does the First Test start? The First Test of the 2015 Ashes series starts on Wednesday, July 8 at 11am. What TV channel is it on? The Ashes will be shown exclusively on Sky Sports, starting at 10am on Sky Sports 2. Also follow live coverage with the Telegraph's live blog, with Alan Tyers and Rob Bagchi. Are there any highlights on TV? Highlights are on Sky Sports 2 from 8pm, and Channel Five at 7pm. What are they saying? Alastair Cook "I'm going to pick another all-rounder - Ben Stokes - to make an impact. He's been in fantastic form this summer. I believe he's coming into his own. He feels comfortable, and I think he's going to have a fantastic summer." Michael Clarke "I've made it very clear, in the last series if someone overstepped that mark when it came to behaviour it was me. And, as captain, I need to be more disciplined, and I will be." England's record at Sophia Gardens England's Test record in Cardiff Result Times Won 1 Drawn 1 Weather forecast Small chance of a brief shower in the morning; otherwise cloudy and cool, with temperatures of around 17C. Follow @telegraphsport
